intro: Wercklea flavovirens, commonly known as the yellow-green corymbiferous plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Restionaceae. It is native to South Africa, where it typically grows in coastal and mountainous regions. The plant is characterized by its dense, wiry stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, arranged in corymbs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to tolerate drought and coastal conditions.
